definition: to create a big disturbance
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: One day, mom was not at home.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈不在家，孩子们闹翻天。

sentences.english: Did you hear the carryings-on next door last night ?
sentences.chinese: 你听见没听见昨晚隔壁闹翻天了？

sentences.english: He'll raise hell if we don't finish on time.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们不按时完工的话，他会闹翻天的。

sentences.english: The party went a whole night, it seemed as the house wound be raised the roof.
sentences.chinese: 派对进行了整个晚上，似乎把房子都要闹翻天。

definition: to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
lit. if you can't eat it all, you'll have to take it home (idiom)/fig. you'll have to take the consequences
pinyin: chi1 bu5 liao3 dou1 zhe5 zou3

definition: lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
see 窩裡鬥|窝里斗[wo1 li5 dou4]
to go wrong/to get into trouble
to stir up trouble
to offend
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to suffer a calamity
fatal/resulting in sb's death
to cause havoc/to run amok
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to make a lot of noise/to be disorderly
